document.discussion_title: In pictures: Highlights of the first weekend on the night tube
document.topic_text: London's Night Tube explained IBTimes UK <iframe src="http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/videos/embed/20034" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" scrolling="no"></iframe> London's long-delayed night tube service finally kicked off over the weekend, and proved hugely popular. More than 50,000 people used the the Central and Victoria lines on the first night of service. One of the busiest stations was Oxford Circus which saw 6,500 people tapping in, while Stratford station saw 4,250 customers tapping out. Some passengers looked tapped-out as well, with quite a few slumped in their seats, and one man photographed apparently urinating on the tracks at Oxford Circus. IBTimes UK presents photos from the night tube's first weekend. A man appears to be urinating on the tracks at Oxford Circus tube station Daniel Leal-Olivas/AFP A man sleeps inside a Central Line train on the night of the launch of the 24-hour night tube service Daniel Leal-Olivas/AFP Passengers wait to get on a night tube service at Oxford Circus Paul Hackett/Reuters A woman takes a nap at White City station waiting for a Central Line train Daniel Leal-Olivas/AFP Jack Taylor/Getty Images
